llama2:70b_direct_sole-planning_results:
Day 1 - March 13th, 2022

* Depart from Washington on flight F3792603 at 9:19 AM, arriving at Myrtle Beach at 10:59 AM.
* Check-in at a budget-friendly hotel such as the Ocean Breeze Inn or the Bay View Inn for approximately $150 per night.
* Spend the afternoon exploring the Myrtle Beach Boardwalk, visiting the SkyWheel, and enjoying the sunset at the beach.
* For dinner, head to the Sea Captain's House, a local seafood restaurant, for a meal costing around $30 per person.

Day 2 - March 14th, 2022

* Start the day with breakfast at the hotel or a nearby café for approximately $10 per person.
* Visit the Myrtle Beach State Park for outdoor activities like hiking, biking, or fishing, with an entrance fee of $8 per person.
* Have lunch at one of the many beachside eateries, such as the Beach Bar & Grill, for around $20 per person.
* Spend the afternoon shopping at the Myrtle Beach Mall or the Tanger Outlets, with a budget of $100 for souvenirs and incidentals.
* For dinner, try the Seafood Buffet at the Golden Corral for around $35 per person.

Day 3 - March 15th, 2022

* Check out of the hotel and depart Myrtle Beach on flight F3791200 at 11:36 AM, arriving in Washington at 1:06 PM.

Budget Breakdown:

* Flights: $328 (round-trip)
* Accommodation: $450 (3 nights at $150 per night)
* Transportation: $0 (self-driving or taxi, budgeted at $34 or $693 respectively)
* Food and Activities: $280 ($30 x 3 meals, $10 x 3 breakfasts, $20 x 2 lunches, $100 for souvenirs and incidentals, $8 for park entrance fee)
* Total: $1,168 (under the budget of $1,400)

This travel plan should help you enjoy a 3-day trip to Myrtle Beach from Washington while keeping your expenses within the given budget. Make sure to adjust the itinerary as needed to suit your personal preferences and any unforeseen costs. Have a great trip!
